intro: Erigeron canus, commonly known as hoary fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its grayish-white fuzzy leaves and daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. Erigeron canus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
